Welcome to the Nobody General

>Who is the Nobody?
Nobody is just a guy alive today. He is many things; all of them are nothing that you couldn't have guessed. As an interdimensional man of destiny, his responsibility was to draw attention away from the true rulers of the universe. To that end his is the only Ego to have survived the The Destruction of Ego (albeit in a synthesized universe which was created especially for him). He used his position as an interdimensional man of destiny to steal the key that opened the locks that freed the beast that began the times of tribulations. He is also the inventor of some gubbmint secret stuff and is the only human-being alive whom the department of energy has the slightest bit of respect for, he believes.

Nobody has a successful business in secondhand succubi. This may be due to his discovery of a dimension where succubi escape to. If so, he employed an anon to sit in this now empty dimension denying the whole thing.

Grey ayys think he's really nice.

He's just like you, but he has found the kingdom of God within himself through sheer dedication, just like you will. He isn't a savior; remember that it's you who creates your own reality. With your hands, thoughts, feelings, words, you are the creator of your story. No one can decide your fate except for you and God. Remember your right to power, to step up into your ultimate role as your highest self, should you choose to embark on that journey.

>What is the general picture?
It’s important we start replying more to the good posters and educating the hateful ones, so call upon their heads the forces of Heaven for peace, clarity, and wisdom. None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. The only motive is love.

If this is your first time here, just remember, it’s going to be ok, you may take shelter and find rest. If you are confused, you are paying attention.

posts.com:
I'm gonna be honest, I don't even think I give a shit about all this occult and philosophical shit, these gang wars etc, I just liked the mystery and the feeling of discovering something new, nothing more. Anybody "winking" at me is enough to make my heart race, thinking that they hold the answers but that was wishful thinking from my part. I was so fucking high for the entirety of my 20's that I don't even remember how being normal feels, so low for the last 5 years that I don't remember how being high feels ( ironic ). Why did they have to target me at my lowest point? It was a recipe for disaster. But also I only have myself to blame at this point and I can't erase that thought now ( I may be hypochondriac but still ), I should have listened to at least some of the advice that were given to me here.
I just wished it happened differently, i wished they could have spared my mind and my thought instead of trying to silence it down. I wished I could have done things differently too, I wished I could have been a little less sensitive, but I still feel like all my weaknesses were played with, so I'll always doubt about the good you tried to do. Doesn't mean it's not real neither.
I never tried to copy anybody, but some people as you know forced these questions in my head, these lies without answers. I don't know myself, I sure as hell don't know you neither, how could I copy anyone?
90% of my dreams were just ways to cope with the feeling of having no power in my life. Lies, yes, but not the one you tell other people. Maybe I lived in these for way too long ( longer that I can remember honestly ), it probably stopped me from becoming the best version of myself too.
I know for certain that I'm not the only one who weakened myself. I know for certain that most of the sin they reproach me were "incepted" into me since childhood. I'm not innocent, but they obviously aren't neither.
Anyway at the end of the day I am to blame, I guess that's just how it is.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
You're suffering from depersonalization/derealization syndrome anon.
The first step to fixing it is to realize that these feelings aren't natural. No- most people do not walk around every single day feeling like a zombie or questioning if the universe around them is the real universe, or what it even means to be "real." It's okay to feel this way though, you're not a shizophrenic and you're not going crazy.
Step two is to start figuring out why you feel whatever way you feel. Stop focusing on why things don't feel real- ignore that feeling for a while and just focus on things. Are you unhappy with yourself, your life, your friends, your family?
Odds are you're not gonna like what you find. These kinds of feelings tend to come about when you don't want to accept whatever is making you upset - maybe you feel at fault for your own misery, maybe you feel like whatever is making you upset makes you a bad person, or maybe you don't want to give up whatever is ruining you. This is where step three comes in: accept the buried feelings you find. That doesn't mean you have to act on them or give in to them, but it means you need to accept them as a part of who you are / how you feel about life. No matter how irrational, whatever making you miserable isn't gonna stop just because you think it's stupid/degenerate/fake/whatever. If you need to change your lifestyle, distance yourself from people, or seek help with coping with or suppressing these feelings then do all of those things. Don't ignore it though. Be open-minded to different solutions, but don't let others tell you who you are.
Anon, whatever is hurting you, whoever you really are deep down, or whatever you're struggling with, things will get better. You can make them better. You deserve to be happy, you deserve the chance to make things right as best you can, and I know if you push yourself things someday will be better.

>>33613152
(1) The Earth's magnetic field is most likely generated by the interaction of flows of molten metal around the core of the planet. The flows of this metal in and out of the core, and around it (through convective processes), generates a magnetic field.

(2) The Coriolis effect and the combined magnetic and electrical generation of these processes keep the movement (very) roughly circular around the axis of rotation. If it was driven solely by convection and the Coriolis effect it would remain very stable for a long time, but the effect of powerful local magnetic fields and electric currents is able to disrupt this circular flow. If this flow is disrupted in one place, it is likely to disrupt in other places, leading to a complete destabilization of flow around the core-mantle boundary. Thus, the field collapses (no more circular flow). However, convection means the process starts up again, possibly in a different direction, possibly in the same direction.
(3) There's plenty of geological evidence to show that pole reversals can occur very quickly, and that on average they take 100-150 years to complete. The decay of our magnetic field began somewhere around 1900, and is accelerating.

As the field decays there will be several noticeable effects. First, it takes a weaker and weaker flare to produce a Carrington type event due to weaker shielding. Second, this weaker shielding results in more high energy particle bombardment in the upper atmosphere (the primary driver of short and long term changes in global climate [notably, most mass extinction events are associated with pole reversals]).

(4) How does electricity work? Not by the flow of electrons per se, but by the interaction of magnetic fields generated by the flow of electrons. The magnetic field of the sun interacts with planetary magnetic fields in the solar system to form an electric circuit. But in terms of this discussion, that interaction doesn't matter so much.

This dust is not conjecture, it is here, and astronomists have been reporting it for about a year now.

The sun is essentially a large nuclear fire. What happens what you throw a bunch of very cold, flammable dust on a fire? I've had bonfires at -40, and I'll tell you: first the fire dampens, then the fire gets much bigger than before and very quickly. The same would occur if you were to bombard the sun with a high amount of cosmic dust - the outer shell would cool, the sun would dim, and then the built up energy in the interior would catch up, the shell would warm up enough, and a "small" explosion would occur in which the outer shell of the sun is cast off.

There are two things to note here:
First, we have observed that the two nearest stellar neighbors to pass through the midplane ahead of us flared. They didn't flare bright enough to call it a super nova, but they flared too much to write it off as a random event or error. They flared in sequence, relative to the time they entered the galactic midplane.

Second: If the outer shell of the sun were to cool, the sun would dim. It may dim so much that the sun itself would turn dark red, possibly even black, dark enough that you could look directly at the sun. Instead of the normal luminescent star you would see a dark circle halo'd by the dust particles and field interaction lines created by the powerful electromagnetic interactions of the sun.

In short, the Black Sun is most likely an ancient symbol from the last time this happened.

Last post.

Back to how they can 'time' the event. In short, it's easy. The magnetic field is weakening:
1900-2000: 5% loss
2000-2010: another 5% loss
2010 to present: we don't know, field strength data is no longer published

Additionally, the poles are moving. >>33596975 demonstrates the movement of the magnetic poles. This tells us we are in a pole shift event, that it will happen, and the end date can be roughly predicted by the rate of field decay.

Additionally there is enough evidence to surmise it does happen every 12,000 years, coinciding with the frequency at which we pass through the galactic midplane. There is not much error in when this happens - we're doing it right now.

As for the crustal displacement theory: the crust is essentially held in place on the mantle by a combination of friction with the partially solid upper mantle and weak electric forces. Solar energy input through the solar-terrestrial magnetic electric circuit can heat up the upper mantle and disrupt these forces, causing the crust to locally displace (pretty much every earthquake over 6.0 is associated with space weather energy inputs). A large enough solar energy input (from a micronova, perhaps) theoretically can liquefy the entire upper mantle and cause the entire crust to detach. Then what happens? The crust still has its momentum, but the most weight is on the poles of its axis of rotation. Spin a weighted ball - the weight comes to the outside of the rotation, and thus Greenland and Antarctica move to the equator.

posts.com:
>>33585321
I mean, there are things going for you in the relationship department next year, but it's more like the potential to try something rather than the promise that something will happen to you.

Main things I'm looking at to give me that impression are Venus being in the sign of her natal placement and conjunct the LOF, Mercury ruling the natal seventh house and conjoining his natal position(and about to make a station no less), Saturn ruling the seventh house of the return while being in the first degrees of Pisces and in his own decan(see pic rel) and I suppose Mars and Sun being in the fifth house of the return is quite a good sign on its own, however I'm a bit reserved about interpreting these two as meaning romance automatically in this instance just because there's so much going on with them this year. That said, Jupiter is the ruler of Sun, Mars, and Saturn in the return chart, and he is angular and conjunct the MC, making a degree-based aspect to the ascendant, so they may very well bring romance to the table this year.

However, I don't like that Saturn rules the descendant and is in a cadent house in the solar return, I don't like that the natal seventh lord is in a cadent house in the solar return, I don't like that Venus is debilitated and in the twelfth house of the nativity, and given how intense some of these signs are, I think many of the indicators which could be saying "love" will be saying "toil" simply because of the reasons indicated previously.

Now, this isn't to say that I don't like your chances, I actually found more going for you than appeared for me at first glance once I gave it a second look, however there will be a lot going on for you during this period, and ultimately if there's just too much chaos for you to invest in a relationship, then that's just the way it is. If you want to make use of what's there, and there *is* plenty there, you're going to have to put in the work ahead of time to prepare yourself for what's to come

>>33618632

Exaltation is a place where a point expresses itself in its purest most unhindered form.

The Nodes are the points in which the Moon's orbital path intersects with the ecliptic (The Earth's orbital path around the Sun). The North Node is where the Moon goes from below the ecliptical plane to above it, while the South Node is where it goes from above that plane to below it.

The North Node is the point where the native would see the most growth in, but growing of course takes effort and hardship. The South Node is the point where the native won't really see any more growth in, as they basically have it down.

Gemini is Hot, Moist, and Mutable. Gemini is assertive, receptive, and yet willing to yield to other forces. Gemini then is a sign that is focused on sharing and exchanging with others, whatever those others are. The North Node here would show that one's growth is best done through such activities as sharing and exchanging, and through that a strong network can eventually be established.

Sagittarius is Hot, Dry, and Mutable. Sagittarius is assertive, independent, and yet willing to give way. With the South Node here, it would show how easy it is for one to have a level of conviction, and so developing that conviction to do what you have to do comes like the back of one's hand. A solid foundation if you will towards going towards other pursuits.

The Depression is the inverse of all of that, where one finds it easy to have their sharing and exchanging networks only to have to grow the best by becoming independent from that, potentially losing all of that in the process.

You just get the most out of the North Node in Gemini and the South Node in Sagittarius.

Granted, the Nodes aren't points of light, so what I said here won't fly with a lot of Astrologers.

Just wanted to share my personal technique I use for self hypnosis/SATS.
>1. I sit on a chair, somewhere quiet where I know I wont be distracted with my feet on the ground and my back straight. I avoid the temptation to lie on bed because I know I will fall asleep.
>2. I start by inhaling for 4 seconds, exhaling for 8 seconds, I repeat this for 5 times. This alone will get me extemely relaxed.
>3. I then imagine my entire body becoming heavy and almost sinking, feeling the sensations of the body and the contact points with the chair and the floor. I imagine and feel my arms becoming heavy, feet becoming heavy almost as if they were glued to the ground. I personally have found affirmations in this stage extremely useful. For example "my feet are becoming extremely heavy". I notice the sensations in my entire body becoming more and more heavy
>4. I count from 10-0 while I give myself the suggestion or command "I will now count from 10-0 and when I reach 0 my body will be completely relaxed, free from any tension. With each number I will become more and more relaxed" When I count each number I also repeat to myself the suggestion "im becoming more and more relaxed" or "im going deeper". I've read that for some people its useful to imagine or visualize being in an elevator and looking at the numbers of the elevator going towards zero and then arriving at the floor and the elevator door opening and stepping out into the subconscious. When I reach 0 I usually repeat some affirmation like "I have arrived, this is the subconscious territory now. I am now able to reprogram and change any belief, habit or idea I want to"
>5. This is were you imagine, visualize, feel or repeat any affirmations you want to. Make the scene as real as possible. In my personal experience suggestions work the best for me since they are always followed by some sort of imagined scene that my brain works out after I give myself the command.

>>33622551
Essentially it means that we do not live in a physical reality. A particle cannot both be a particle and a wave. The fact is there is no particle or wave. Information is only rendered when we ask for it (the observer effect). When we are attempting to get the information of where the particle hit on the board in the back, that is when the "particle" comes into existence.

Where the particle can land is based on probability. In the case where there is no detector, we get a probability distribution. In the case where we know which slit it when through we get the two slits. If you look at the delayed choice quantum eraser experiments it becomes more obvious.

You can also check out the video on this experiment
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t_RwcGzGurc

The truth is nobody knows. We have a lot of educated guesses- from many worlds interpretation to pilot wave interpretation to the Copenhagen interpretation- but these are as much metaphysics as they are science and none of them have made any testable predictions yet.

A few things to note: an observer doesn’t have to be human or even alive. An “observer” in physics is anything that can encode information from the particle, which can be as much as a photon. Therefore things like a tree that always have a million billion particles bouncing through or off them are always “real.”

Personally, my favorite interpretation of the experiment is the idea of the participatory universe. This basically says that particles don’t really exist, just the interactions between them.

posts.name: MercuryAttack
posts.com:
>>33610978
My first psychotic break came after a combination of not sleeping for a week, and the "initial consideration" that the television had taken a direct interest in me.

At first the experience was extreme elation, but as the delusions mounted, it turned into the most paranoid fear for my life I ever had -- long story short, it was only by extreme luck that nothing "triggered" a violent reaction out of me that day, especially when the police eventually showed up because I was... PUBLICALLY ALARMING A LOT OF PEOPLE. A lot of people aren't so lucky, the cops show up, and one violent thing leads to another.

After that initial episode of "acute florid psychosis" came two months of painful clinical depression. See, the happy stim neurotransmitters go apeshit for days during psychosis, and then you're left with a severe deficit of them -- not a fun time.

I'm quite sure I have never had wholesale HALLUCINATIONS -- seeing or hearing things that aren't there -- but that idea that set me off to begin with, "suggestive" talk from TV and radio, never really go away.

"Do they know who I am? How? Why?" If I thought about it too long too deeply, it was usually cause for more paranoia, more psychosis, back to the hospital. Now I just keep those ideas at arm's length... most the time. The things I used to be scared of the most did not come to pass, so I choose not to accept the fear or the "threats" like I used to.

After a long time of wrestling with the delusions, I have enough "insight" about what kind of thinking is straight up irrational and will only fuel another psychotic episode -- last one was early 2009.

But I'm aware in changes to my personality. I used to be a lot more emotionally insular. I used to worry about random people's perception of me. I used to be very obsessive about some things to just tune out the outside world because I was mostly disinterested and resentful of nonsense.

I've learned to roll with a lot of punches over the years. A lot.

I used to frequent this board daily before I came close to completing my undergraduate. You can call me indoctrinated, normie or brainwashed all you want, but I am genuinely concerned for almost every anon in this thread who is struggling with severe mental health issues.

I refuse to argue with anyone on the chans anymore because it's like trying to kick water uphill, but for what it's worth, I hope those that are struggling find the help they need. It's okay to be skeptical. It's okay to not take any sort of medication that you do not trust. It's your right as a human being to control what goes into your body. What isn't okay is having someone (or anyone for that matter) do your thinking for you. Rejecting mainstream science and blindly embracing the beliefs of someone that does not have the qualifications or the knowledge to make these claims make you no different from the sheeple that some accuse others of being.

I wish all you guys the best. Stay strong and fight the good fight.

*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Continue daily for a minimum of two months and count out 3 weeks with no die off symptoms prior to moving to the next step.

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Morning

*600mg NAC
*500mg Slo Niacin (nicotinic acid)
*100mg Pterostilbene
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

*500mg Slo Niacin
*100mg Pterostilbene
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

After every 3 weeks on the maintenance protocol, take 1 week off. Continue to use black seed oil during the off cycle.

Fungal die off symptoms may include :

Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

Ok so that test method reads like the sample is getting blasted the entire time with the uM levels that showed damage. >>33614377

No. Oregano oil supplements are diluted with a carrier oil, such as olive oil. If you take it without diluting it, it will cause burns unless it's already diluted.

To make it safe to ingest you dilute the oregano essential oil with olive oil. Diluting it to 50% oregano oil will render it harmless for you but maintain it's effects as an anti-fungal. It also works as a "antibiotic", however based on repeated studies, we have found that it doesn't kill probiotics, only delays, and then slightly slows their rate of growth.

An example below shows that they have used it for culturing cheese due to the fact that it is able to significantly reduce E-Coli for example, but at the same time keep species like Lactobacillus acidophilus alive and while barely affecting their count.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31703879/

Cont.

You seem to have concerns with Oregano oil and Black Seed oil, and that's reasonable. People have claimed that some herbal supplements put stress on the liver. >Black Seed oil

>Oregano
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33013016/

The protocol is designed so that these substances don't "chip away" at your health but improve it, and it's also the reason why the protocol itself follows the recommended dosage on the package of the supplements for long term because that is the amount that is safe to use if you have no underlying medical conditions. Mixing them doesn't make it more toxic and is still safe based on what the lethal dosage suggests for each. If you get severe die-off symptoms, then you should reduce the dosage of NAC and Oregano oil and take molybdenum. Start taking full doses again once recovered.

For context, die-off symptoms occur when the biofilm breaks down and exposes the pathogenic fungi. Doing that can cause an immune response, which is what causes the die off symptoms. The goal is to remove the fungi at a slow enough pace where the die-off symptoms are minor and you can, for example, still go to work without any major issues.

It's also to note that the protocol may not be safe for some people, and you should do your own research and talk to your doctor about using the supplements. Combining a bleeding disorder, high blood pressure, very low blood pressure, or diabetes with the protocol without consulting a doctor first for example would be unwise.

Feel free to post valid criticisms or concerns, any legitimate and backed up criticism is appreciated.

posts.name: Space Cowboy
posts.com:
Another reason why the protocol is necessary to eliminate CDF.

These shape shifters masquerading as normal fungi use a variety of intelligent and targeted techniques to evade immune response. You may have seen the recent video I posted of Candida as an example, where it behaves as a normal yeast cell until surrounded by the wbc then changes shape and kills the immune defender.

But there are many more methods it uses, and it doesn't appear situational. It's almost like it's playing with it's food.

One example of intelligent evasion is the exchange of micro RNA to trick monocytes. Here's a link:

https://journals.asm.org/doi/full/10.1128/mbio.03563-21

I could give many more examples and I may because I have some downtime today. But beyond its intelligent evasion techniques, the genetic breaks we discuss directly benefit it's virulence. We can look at specific errors with Familial Candidiasis and say 'how convenient for the fungus' many times over.

We haven't really expanded on these directions so perhaps a deeper dive into its intelligent behavior would be good.

posts.name: Space Cowboy
posts.com:
Here's another example of how these fungi evade immune response. First the details:

>this pathogen has developed multiple strategies to escape host immune defense. Here, we show that C. albicans secreted proteases interfere and inactivate host innate immune effector components, such as complement proteins. Secreted aspartic proteases (Saps) in the culture supernatant of C. albicans cells and also recombinant Sap1, Sap2 and Sap3 degrade host complement components C3b, C4b and C5 and also inhibit terminal complement complex (TCC) formation.

In plain English they secrete proteins that degrade receptors on white blood cells, allowing it to evade detection.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0161589009006932

This is also connected to one of the genetic breaks from Familial Candidiasis (FC) where errors in receptor pattern recognition allow the fungus to avoid sensing defenses. It's interesting that an active evasion technique matches a genetic break. Very convenient.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Does anyone else on here not fully trust the cosmic death fungus generals constantly posted on /x/? It seems whoever’s posting them sees fungi as their enemy, and their agenda seems to be the complete separation of man and fungi. But let’s review some basic points:
>Fungi are an integral part of nature, vital for nutrient recycling within the soil. They are the bridge between death and new life in many ecosystems.
>Many fungi are at the root of ancient and modern medicines, used to cure everything from infections to cancer. Penicillin alone has helped save countless lives in the past century.
>Fungi are at the heart of human culture and food. The bread and wine of Jesus are yeasted foods. The holy cacao of the Mesoamericans and the coffee of the Sufis are also products that have undergone fermentation in order to fully harness their mystic properties.
>Ergot and Psilocybin mushrooms are prehistoric mind openers, which likely facilitated man’s journey towards spirituality. They enable ordinary people to briefly see as the mystics see, and have helped countless people open their eyes to the divine nature of existence.
Now I’m not saying that all fungus is good. People do die or suffer from fungal infections, and there are many mushrooms that are deadly if consumed. But we can say the same about any natural phenomena. They aren’t wholly good or evil, they are a part of nature, the same divine nature which humans sprung from, and which modernity increasingly separates us from. So I’m incredibly sceptical of anyone who insists that it is a good thing to purge this from our bodies. In recent years we have come to understand just how vital our gut bacteria is, not just for our digestion, but for our whole body and brain function as well. Perhaps one day we will find out the same thing about the fungus. In the end, there is only unity.

You will never have a flat Earth. You have no model, you have no math, you have no testable predictions. You have a zoomed in photo twisted by bad line-of-sight calculations and weed into a crude mockery of God's perfection.

All the “validation” you get is two-faced and half-hearted. Behind your back people mock you. Your parents are disgusted and ashamed of you, and your “friends” laugh at your flattie videos behind closed doors.

Rational people are utterly repulsed by you. Thousands of hours of education allow smart people to sniff out pseudo scientific frauds with incredible efficiency. Even flat Earth photos which “pass” look uncanny and unnatural to a thinking person. Your unanswerable questions are a dead giveaway. And even if you manage to get a drunk girl to watch a video with you, she’ll turn tail and bolt the second she realizes you weren't just joking about flat Earth conspiracy theory.

You will never be happy. You wrench out a fake "I know it's true!" every single morning and tell yourself others are going to believe. But deep inside you feel the depression creeping up like a weed, ready to crush you under the unbearable weight caused by the force you deny, Earth's gravity.

Eventually it’ll be too much to bear – you’ll buy a ring laser gyroscope, start your livestream, and plunge into the cold abyss of Internet mockery. Your parents will find you accidentally proving the globe, heartbroken but relieved that they no longer have to live with the unbearable shame and disappointment. They'll copy and upload your video across social media, and every viewer for the rest of eternity will know Earth is a rotating globe. Your flat Earth videos will decay and get deleted from YouTube, and all that will remain of your legacy is a video with an experiment that unmistakably proves the globe.

This is your fate. This is what you chose. There is no turning back.

I am called Semjase and I come from the Pleiades. From the Seven Stars.

1. Already for a long time we have felt the urge to get in touch with a human being on the Earth who wants to be helpful in honesty and very real to our task.

2. This attempt has already been made very often, but the chosen human beings were not knowing and willing enough, and there was often also a lack of honesty and loyalty.

3. Those whom we could have engaged in our efforts, however, were afraid and remained silent about our appearance.

4. They claimed that they would be insulted for spirit-illness and that attempts would be made through official and foolish human intrigues to destroy them and accuse them of lying.

5. Instead, however, very many human beings seeking renown appeared, who claimed to have contact with us and even to have flown in our beamships.

6. But they are nothing other than charlatans and deceivers, who want to bask in dubious glory and capitalize on it.

7. The Earth-humans have entire organizations that deal with reconnaissance of our beamships, but among them all, there is only very little material that is really genuine.

8. They are in possession of very many photos, which, however, depict nothing more than some lights and light phenomena of natural origin or quite deliberate counterfeits.

9. Only very few of these photographic proofs are genuine and really show our beamships.

10. Most of the photos are just montages or forged recordings made by deceivers and charlatans, whose names thereby became known worldwide.

11. Their books and their writings written in this way represent also only an evil fraud for the purpose of seeking renown or charlatanry.

12. On the other hand, however, many dare to associate us with the human religion, with which we have nothing to do and also never want anything to do.

13. Your so-called sectarians do not even shy away from this step and are themselves deceiving their fellow human beings with the belief.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33621098
14. These infamous and tentatively primitive machinations should be stopped before the world is completely gripped by them.

15. If the deceivers and charlatans were actually linked to us and, thus, were standing or have stood in contact with us, then we would have given them the opportunity to create very clear photo evidence of our beamships.

16. But since they are dishonest human beings, we have not given them this opportunity.

17. As proof for this fact, we will give you the opportunity to take clear pictures of one of our beamships.

18. But we will also continue to give you such opportunities to create even better and clearer picture evidence.

19. The Earth-human calls us "extraterrestrials" or "star people" or whatever he/she likes.
20. He/she imputes supernaturality to us and does not know us in the least.

21. In reality, we are human beings just like the Earth-humans, except that our knowledge and our essence of wisdom are far superior to theirs, so also from a technological point of view.

22. It is true that the Earth-human has taken the first very small step towards outer space flight, but that means nothing more than the first rather primitive attempts.

23. Even though he/she has reached the moon with rockets, he/she still hasn't reached the outer space yet.

24. He/she would also never reach it in the present form; what is needed for this is a propulsion system capable of penetrating hyperspace and causing the unending distances to collapse.

25. Space and time are not overcome by space and time, but by the spaceless and the timeless, which means that space and time collapse in themselves and become equally directed to null time.

26. As a result, a few fractions of a second can suffice to rush through millions of light-years, practically without a loss of time, because null time paralyzes space and time.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33621134
27. Many deceivers and charlatans claim that they would be in contact with planetary human beings of your solar system and that they have even flown with or in their beamships.

28. That is nothing more than a lie, as for the most part, the stars mentioned by them and their planets are so inhospitable that human life would be impossible.

29. Other planets, on the other hand, have long since died out of life, or they are only in the developmental stages.

30. Other solar systems, however, harbor a variety of lives, not just human ones.
31. The forms of life are diverse – human as well as animal.
32. Also, many animal or even plant life-forms have developed to highly advanced level of life.
33. So there are species who have attained great knowledge and have freed themselves from their spheres of life, who travel outer space and also come to your Earth every now and then.

34. Many of them, however, are unpleasant contemporaries and live in a certain barbarism, which is often almost as bad as that of the Earth-human.

35. One must watch out for them because they often combat and destroy everything that gets in their way.

36. Already often they have destroyed entire planets or forced their inhabitants into barbaric slavery.

posts.name: Anonymouse

37. This is one of our tasks:
38. To warn the Earth-human about these creatures.
39. Let the human beings know this, because more and more the time approaches, when a clash with these degenerate human creatures becomes unavoidable.

40. Another task is aimed at the sects and religions and the underdevelopment of human consciousness associated with these.

41. Above all there is only one thing that possesses the power over life and death of every creature.

42. This is the Creation alone, who has laid out her laws over everything – laws that are irrefutable and that have eternal validity.
43. The human being can recognize them in nature, if he/she strives for it.

44. They show him/her the path of life and the path to the spiritual and consciousness-based greatness, which represent the life-determination.

45. But as the human being indulges in his/her religions, and thus in evil irrational teachings, his/her consciousness atrophies more and more and leads ultimately to a bottomless abyss.

46. The human being may realize that a god can never assume the role of the Creation or determine the destiny of the human being.

47. A god is only a ruler and moreover a human being, who mightily exercises rule or tyranny over his fellow human beings.

48. God is not the Creation, but only a creature of her, like all creatures dependent on the Creation.

49. However, the human being chases after his/her religious irrational belief and claims that God is the Creation herself.

50. But he/she goes even further and claims that an ordinary Earth-human named Jmmanuel, who through deliberate error is also called Jesus Christ, would be the son of God and would be the Creation herself.

51. Different sectarians of the new time go even further and claim things that already come close to insanity.

53. Quite clearly they put out the lie to the world, that we or our brothers and sisters from other parts of the outer space would come here by order of God (by which they mean the Creation) as angels or the like, in order to bring the Earth-humans the long-desired peace and the truth of religion and the protection and commands of God.

One day, (You) will have to find the truth yourselves, and only then will (You) take it in as knowledge. At present time, the individuals who are the least agreeable to recognise and disseminate the truth should be those who had allowed themselves to be deceived by deceivers and charlatans for decades, and who had sacrificed millions for the dissemination of the stories of lies and books of lies.

For them a world would collapse because they would have to recognize themselves as deceived and would have to disgrace themselves in front of the public.

The Earth-humans are not able to bear and recognize their responsibility themselves, although they should do so. So they roll everything off and onto something that they put above themselves in their imagination; things that they simply call religion or God, that are supposed to relieve them of the responsibility.

If deceivers label and describe us mendaciously. It is nothing more than an infamous lie, originating from the brains of consciously poor human beings who imagine a better life in their fantasy, and because they themselves cannot achieve it, at least not yet in this life, they simply attribute it to us and make us out to be something perfect.
But we, too, are still far away from this stage and must continually develop ourselves further.

We are not the so-called above-human or superhuman beings, as the Earth-humans like to call us in their unknowledge and in their imaginations. We are also no teachers, missionaries or pioneers.

We only have the dutiful task of preserving the developing as well as already existing human life throughout the cosmic space. This means that we strive to keep order and watch over certain life.

Here and there we approach the inhabitants of different worlds, if our directives allow us to do so, choose individuals from among them and provide them with explanations; this however only then when a race develops higher and slowly becomes thinking.

Without exception, all governments on Earth are staffed by human beings who have the characteristic of addiction to might and profit.
Under the guise of peace and friendship they would only want to seize our beamships to be able to exercise absolute Gewalt-rule over the Earth with them. But they would also try to conquer the outer space because they know no bounds.

However, they are not even able to on the Earth create peace and friendship between the countries – not even among the human beings in their own country.

How, then, should they be able to have such means of might at their disposal, such as are our beamships and their multifaceted facilities represent it!

There is no interest in showing ourselves to the general public. Their consciousness is still short and small and confined in religious enslavement.

>>33624488
Basically the same as you would any other god/ess. Learn as much about them as you can. Then, think about what they stand for. What are their lessons? How do they behave? Do they say how you should behave? If not, then looking at what you know, how do you think they want you to behave? Now, apply that to your everyday life.

Be sure to give thanks for any blessings you receive. Making a small altar can help in this as it gives you a place to pray and leave offerings. Choose items They like and use that as inspiration.

>Examples of this stuff using Aphrodite
Do your own work. here. Don't just use my ideas. The personal nature of your effort is a form of worship, too, and will mean more than just doing stuff I suggest.

Aphrodite is a goddess of love, both erotic and not. One of her alternate names roughly means "She who loves smiles". Consider the nature of love and it's place in your life. Who do you love? Love yourself, others and the world as best as you can. Share a smile. Bring joy. Also learn from her mistakes. If you have/get someone who loves you, treat them right.

The altar should be made of Applewood or Myrtle if possible. A box turned upsideown works fine. Lovingly carve or paint her favorite things on it such as roses and doves. Adorn it with pearls and mirrors. Offer sweet treats like you would a lover. Candied roses, heart shaped chocolates, seashell chocolates, rose scented candles, ect.

I hope this is a good starting point!

posts.com:
Santa denial is the ultimate result of a society that has reached its apex of rationalism and intellectualism, while concurrently burying its spiritual and ritualistic side of itself. We live in an Apollonian age of numbers, results, capital, etc. and it is killing the side of ourselves that believes in anything - this naturally leads to nihilism and bleakness. The same nihilism and bleakness that presides over the entirety of our culture today. This is why you don't see any great works of art anymore.

A Santa Denier is the man who deems himself intellectual for believing in the "science"; yet, has this man done his own research? He believes in molecules, yet has he seen them for himself under a microscope? I say, "NO". He was merely told this was the case from some book, or from some teacher. So, here, we see, this intellectual man is just as vulnerable to belief systems as anyone else.

William James backs me up in his essay, "The Will to Believe":
>"Yet if any one should thereupon assume that intellectual insight is what remains after wish and will and sentimental preference have taken wing, or that pure reason is what then settles our opinions, he would fly quite as directly in the teeth of the facts."

Santa IS real, because we believe him to be; it is as simple as that. When you see a present under the tree that says "From: Santa", that is all the proof you need.

I finish my essay with a question:
Walking through the mall are two people,
1.) A small child who just sat on Santa's lap and told him of their wishes, and is fully content after having participated in ritual and tradition. They fully believe that this Santa will fulfill all of their wishes.
2.) The smirking intellectual, who "knows" in his head that Santa is not real, and thinks that this child is naïve - yet he participates in the tradition, gift bags in hand, supporting the corporations and 1% he claims to hate.

Who is happier?

Pic unironically related. Don't like it? Seethe harder chuddies.
Tulpas are real, but that probably doesn't surprise you since you schizo retards think every fucking paranormal phenomenon is real. What might actually surprise you is this: Tulpas aren't paranormal. They're natural and mundane, and here's how they work.
Everything you think about is an actual physical process in your brain. Just because it's imaginary doesn't mean it's not real. It has substance and matter to it: specifically, your brain matter. The same matter that sustains your consciousness and defines your personality. If you think your mind itself is real, surely everything you imagine is at least somewhat real; after all, the simulation you conjure runs on the same wetware as your mind.
Notice I said "at least somewhat real." How real something you imagine is, is something you can control. Not in some stupid manifest destiny or new-age quantum-manifest-destiny shit sense; no, imagining something can never magically manifest it outside your brain, except through the vector that is your deliberate and mechanical action to realize it. Rather, what you imagine is a simulation. The harder you think about it, the more neurological resources you allocate to the simulation. If you allocate enough, it may run at very high precision and detail. It's possible to even get it to run with greater reality than your very mind itself, but to do this you have to cannibalize your mind for resources.
Now suppose what you're imagining is another mind. Imagine you have a second mind. Talk to it. Now put lots of effort into thinking about what it would say back. Think about it as hard as you can. Really put yourself in that other mind's shoes. Think about it so hard you neglect your own feelings and value system.
That's how you create a tulpa. That's literally all it is.

Np, I don't care about Carlos. I denounce Carlos and his fiddly tiddly widdly tensegrity deathmoneycult ways.

To go back to my original interest - I see parallels in what is described as seeing energy as in feeling a better place for yourself in a room, and being transformed during some of his trips into a crow, or how he described departure from his body similar (in how he describes them) to how one feels when lucid dreaming, leaving your body and doing memory palace practice, which I view to be differently interpreted, but still the same phenomenon.

As in they all require a very specific shift of awareness into primarily spacial awareness, that acts as a unified sort of unisense, as in a dream - you are no longer bound to a cone perception or perceiving "from" somewhere.

I also discovered that this spacial unisense has a tendency to put one into a dream state, which is very suggestive (suspension of critical thinking), and is entirely alien to common "identification" based speech mind. I then saw similarity between that and (how I understand them) methods and goals of raja yoga. Or at least this state makes dhyana much more possible. I will not go into detail on how I understand speech thinking to be staccato like, quantised in nature, opposite to dream non-speech spacial (to a certain point when it is not even spacial any more) mind, that is continuous, suffuce to say that they are to me.

So with these observations I came to a conclusion that he is describing phenomena from a valid, actually practical something, that he might have not fully understood, or didn't even think about as such, but nevertheless, somehow described.

And I was just interested in ideas that other people have about phenomena described in his books, people with experience in both what he described and other working systems. And also commentary on what I described and concluded above.

It came to me in a dream.
I'm both joking and not. I just came to a conclusion and belief that for me it, and also non-verbal awake dreaming states (I don't know how to better describe them without explaining a lot of other idiosyncratic stuff), are an axis of methodology used in raja yoga, ritual, and just accessing that particular state of mind that makes things (magick, attainment, contact) possible.

If we're talking about asana in raja yoga, I perceive it to be stillness of the body that achieves a very specific spacial feeling of the body. Same with pranayama, which (the way I understand it) joins asana in this spaciality as asana-in-motion. Pratyahara (also the way I understand it) is not absence of thoughts, but absence of identifying state of mind, and presence of mind that observes, but doesn't identify that which is observed. It is a prerequisite for dreaming (for any person every night), and both (pratyahara and dreaming) are much more easily achieved in the spacial awareness, thus proper asana and pranayama lead to pratyahara. Dharana is also much easier in the spacial awareness, because spacial perception doesn't require you to identify that place that you focus on, thus stilling attention is achieved much more easily.

Like I wrote earlier non-verbal (in a broad sense, as in a non-identifying) state is necessary to fall asleep at night and has a continuous nature (as opposed to interruptive identification of verbal state of mind), thus it makes continuous dharana (which, the way I understand it, in continuation becomes dhyana) possible. And if it is continuous for long enough becomes self-sustaining samadhi,which changes a human being.

Well, at least that's my idiosyncratic reasoning, conjectures and understating.

With this logic every human being experiences yoga and possibly samadhi every night.

More Palgrave studies on Witchcraft:

Werewolf Histories, the first English academic study of the history and mysticism of the werewolf phenomenon.
Fairies, Demons, and Nature Spirits - includes a chapter on the Headless Ones which will be of interest to Thelemites and GMP practitioners.

Narratives and Rituals of the Nightmare Hag in Scandanavian Folk Belif - what is says on the tin.
Goddesses, Elixirs, and Witches: Plants and Sexuality Throughout Human History.

Oh plus Alembick of the Wise.

>>33625460
Idk why they don't organize the material but here's what they do:
- Forcing silence. They silence their mind throughout their waking life. Absolutely no internal dialogue whatsoever. One finds that it's actually possible. They compare those who are adept with it to enlightened people which are low level for them.
- Recapitulation. By imagining every memory we have of a person, breathing in, turning to the right, exhaling to the left, then turning the head right to left again with no breathing we regain energy those memories suck in and we lessen attachment to this world thus silencing the mind even more.
- Darkroom Practice. For beginners and intermediates they practice forcing silence three hours a day, stare at pitch black darkness, look for puffs (yes, those colorful things you see in the darkness), play with them, do Tensegrity (their yoga with every movement having different functions but its mostly to build an energy body that can navigate other worlds), and maybe meet entities and see other worlds in said puffs. You also gain energy from this.
There are many more but these are the ones they commonly discuss. Some important stuff that are too long to explain are the J curve and other metaphysics stuff.
My theory is that we are immersed in our world just like how immersed we are in a dream. Their practices are just to lessen immersion in this world (silence and recapitulation) and they experience otherworldly stuff by looking at and interacting with things "not apart of this world" with a silent mind (another type of immersion).

Like many people have already pointed out, OP has it the opposite way around.

Inner voice/monologue is just subvocalization. It is a slower form of thinking that reinforces ego and linear thought spirals. It is like the difference between communicating through language vs. communicating through telepathy, except when you subvocalize you are just putting an unnecessary constraint on the communication and information transfer happening within your own mind.

People who do not subvocalize are thinking spatio-visually like >>33622728 mentioned, which is general "faster" and promotes lateral thinking. This style of thinking is superior imo but taken to the extreme it looks closer to schizophrenia. Notice how schizophrenics struggle to maintain a fixed identity? This is because they have no monologue reinforcing their ego. There are obviously more reasons but that is a big reason for developing schizophrenia imo.

Neither way of thinking is more correct, and an ego is not necessarily a bad thing, without ego we would have no reason to eat or piss or do anything necessary for basic survival. That said, people should be able to just switch between either mode of thinking. I am always surprised when people present this as a binary option. If you cannot think in either mode at will, it is probably because you have reinforced one way at the expense of the other. This can be fixed by just practicing visualization or subvocalization, depending on which one you lack. It has nothing to do with someone lacking a soul or being born an NPC. Most people become confuse their inner monologue with their soul/spirit because our culture reinforces types of thinking that promote narcissism and reward egoic behavior.

You really shouldn't call anyone an NPC or imply someone lacks a soul. You could send someone into a seriously bad thought spiral and confuse the people with REAL souls who have simply been spiritually lobotomized by a culture they were born into.

I saw Nexpo at a grocery store in Los Angeles yesterday. I told him how cool it was to meet him in person, but I didn’t want to be a douche and bother him and ask him for photos or anything. He said, “Oh, like you’re doing now?” I was taken aback, and all I could say was “Huh?” but he kept cutting me off and going “huh? huh? huh?” and closing his hand shut in front of my face. I walked away and continued with my shopping, and I heard him chuckle as I walked off. When I came to pay for my stuff up front I saw him trying to walk out the doors with like fifteen Milky Ways in his hands without paying.

The girl at the counter was very nice about it and professional, and was like “Sir, you need to pay for those first.” At first he kept pretending to be tired and not hear her, but eventually turned back around and brought them to the counter.

When she took one of the bars and started scanning it multiple times, he stopped her and told her to scan them each individually “to prevent any electrical infetterence,” and then turned around and winked at me. I don’t even think that’s a word. After she scanned each bar and put them in a bag and started to say the price, he kept interrupting her by yawning really loudly.

Liminality:
>is the quality of ambiguity or disorientation that occurs in the middle stage of a rite of passage, when participants no longer hold their pre-ritual status but have not yet begun the transition to the status they will hold when the rite is complete.[2] During a rite's liminal stage, participants "stand at the threshold"[3] between their previous way of structuring their identity, time, or community, and a new way (which completing the rite establishes).

>More recently, usage of the term has broadened to describe political and cultural change as well as rites.[5][6] During liminal periods of all kinds, social hierarchies may be reversed or temporarily dissolved, continuity of tradition may become uncertain, and future outcomes once taken for granted may be thrown into doubt.[7] The dissolution of order during liminality creates a fluid, malleable situation that enables new institutions and customs to become established.

posts.com:
Most of the time these things have no effect on me, not sure why that is. It's like my brain can't get into that imaginative space anymore where I imagine myself in the 'world' of the image.

That said I think I might understand the feeling that's involved here. When I was like 6 my best friend left and I remember going home and standing in the backyard alone, it was sunny but quiet and cool and I remember standing there getting goosebumps and just feeling almost a form of pleasure in my body at the shift in perspective thinking that this 'time' with my friend was gone now and wouldn't be coming back.

There was also this time back in early 2011 when my family moved to another city but left me staying at the family home a while (it was rented) till I could get a place, it was summer and I suddenly had the house all to myself - two pets had recently died also so it was just me and one remaining pet. I was spending a lot of time on r9k in 2010 and then it was banned suddenly, so I was a NEET, alone with nobody in the world who knew me, and even that place of connection had suddenly disappeared, so I was totally alone, but I was happy and enjoying myself reading. The sunlight would stream in with a very sort of reddish hue in the afternoon and the stillness and peace was so beautiful and sacred, I often get almost like 'flashbacks' to my time there for a few months.

I returned to r9k and spent some more time there, and felt more connection and so on - then the culture changed and I found myself feeling alienated and alone and so I'd go back to the archives a fair bit and get this sense of the hauntedness of this 'space', even though it wasn't even a 'space' at all. It's weird the disconnect between visiting a 'live' site and visiting the archives - technically there should be no meaningful difference in experience apart from the interactivity of communication. Again I would get this beautiful, sad, nostalgic, haunted feeling.

I was with a friend in zanzibar and we got really drunk with some portugese girls one night. The next night we went on a reef exploration trip or something and we drove there with a small boat and a few locals. I was hungover and got seasick along the way.

The 'driver' of the boat at some point made us some chopped fruit and I remember starting to feel a bit better, talking to this portugese girl when all of a sudden I get this refluc feeling in my throat like I am close to vomiting. I say nothing, just jump off the boat in the shallow water and wade to the beach.

I walk along the beach for a minute or so, the sun was shining down brutally. I am on this uninhabited island with beautiful sea all around me and I spot an old little fishing vessel about 2 meters long on the beach. I walk up to it and sit on its old wooden hull, a leaning pose.

I remember looking around me, there was noone around, just me, the sky and the sea and this old wooden fishing boat. It was truly a surreal experience. Half a world away in a place I dont know I get this feeling that I am on the right track with my life and that this is exactly where I am meant to be in this specific moment and oddly enough, that I have been here before. It was magical, one of my fondest memories.

I liked your post anon so I decided to portray a kind of surreal experience that happened to me.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I think the real issue is that people have gotten lazy in terms of internet use and creating OC online - most of the OC generation going on today seems to be on twitter, tiktok, instagram etc and it's always OC created within certain political and normality limits. The "free internet" sites like 4chan have essentially ossified and died. 4chan's users are now mostly just passing posters, with very little real investment in creating or maintaining any sort of board or site-wide culture, and 4chan is colonised by the OC creation and culture of twitter, and also discord (in a sense this was 'reverse colonisation', as discord itself appropriated everything from 4chan, then the backwash ruined 4chan).

Internet cultures\communities have risen and fallen at a rapid pace since the mid 90's. I used a regular on IRC from about 1996 to 2014 or so, and in that time I saw lots of cultures thrive and fall, different servers, different channels, different people with different values coming together in different ways, all of this involves constant 'death' and abandonment of previous cultures\communities. Also over time the cultures\communities often become solidified, so you have some "terminally online" people who tend to set themselves up as OPS or channel owners on IRC to maintain a position of social status, and get stuck there, same thing happens on discord I guess. So you actually have lots of communities that slow down to a snails pace where various individuals get 'stuck' or become 'comfortable' there, and then these people are essentially isolated from taking part in and creating OC in other online spaces.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33618137

Another factor I've observed is that porn use and posting ruined a lot of cultures on many levels. Therapy sites I once went to used to be filled with interesting fun young people trying to help others, now they're dominated by catfish narcissists (often trannies for some reason) and 'sex chatters' who completely disrupt anyone trying to use the sites for their actual intended purposes. On 4chan, porn posting ruined the NSFW boards for me, and I know it ruined them for others. The universality of porn also means you have far more people who are constantly running on low dopamine, so they have shorter attention spans, in many cases are probably posting with one hand while fapping furiously to porn with another, etc.

Commercialisation is another factor. I mentioned discord's cultural appropriation in my previous post - well pretty much all of 4chan type culture was appropriated and mainstreamised first by sides like Encyclopedia Dramatica, but later on tens of authors have written books, there have been movies (at least two movies about r9k culture specifically), and 4chan has been mentioned on mainstream movies and TV thousands of times, latest one I saw was the most recent 'Scream' movie. All of this empties out the culture, and also creates a situation where most people are aware that anything they create will be appropriated by others, sometimes for nefarious purposes, it stifles discussion.

The internet has also become increasingly legislated and policed, which means it's more and more dangerous to express your opinion online, and we're all aware on some level that anything we post could be used against us in some way by spooks or others.

Just a bunch of factors that come to mind that can give this impression of the internet being 'dead'.

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Youtube Guides:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YQjAIlFZWWc&t=790s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Dj9gTiLHf8
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7BMnGi8yxTQ

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

alright, make sure your body is very relaxed/tired or have high sleep pressure [also known as sleep drive]
then passively observe the hypnagogic images and wait for them to morph and evolve until their latest stage just before sleep [for me it goes something like this: blobs -> recognizable blurry items -> blurry pictures -> blurry videos -> hd videos]
last step is waiting for hypnagogia with multiple senses and interact with it
i suggest doing this after wbtb or at least in the process of taking a nap, doing it at the beginning of the night is practically like waiting an hour at the bus stop
hope this helps, gl dayo

Had an insane lucid dream. Like most of them sex was in it but scattered between everything for some reason. I was actually able to consciously speak to my own mind. I'm assuming that's what dreams are made of, since a single thought and the entire landscape changes.

Skipping the boring bits and bubbling them down: like most nightmares I came across some bad shit that chased me, but I chased them back since I was lucid and they ran scared lol. Anyways, I was walking down this school highway with all these kids and we were going to recess. I caught up with one random kid and tried talking to him. Eventually he turned into a kid version of me, and I tried explaining to him how surreal this was literally talking to myself. He didn't say much, but his smile was bright and he kept nodding. It felt like he knew all along what I was going to say. I wanted to tell him how much he mattered to me, how I'd promise to take good care of him and if he needed anything, just tell me. He seemed to understand. Kind of wish he spoke more, but it was still cool having some kind of dialogue with myself. Which sounds retarded in retrospect but anyone who has done lucid dreams I'm sure will tell you: it's a lot cooler talking to yourself and being able to hold your own hand, then it is when you're awake.

posts.com:
Lately my attitude towards everything has been vastly improved, by choice. I'm saying positive affirmations a lot, am doing yoga, eating well, and generally have a more empowered feeling. This has been reflected in my dreams! I have more awareness in general, and more control once I become lucid.
The other night set the bar higher for me. I woke up about half an hour before my alarm, and decided to have a good dream for the remaining time. I lay in bed thinking about all the people I'm thankful to have in my life, and then proceeded to dream for what felt like an entire day, about going to a "waterpark" with my fiancée. It was sort of like the poolrooms, only outside, in the sun. Occasionally, I would get the typical worries I get while on vacation - is the dog being taken care of well, etc. But then I would remind myself it was just a dream. Literally the best dream I've ever had.
I've changed my tactic basically. Rather than becoming lucid and trying to teleport to where I want to be, I set positive intentions while awake and then go lucid in whatever place I end up. Guides in this general have helped a lot!
Last night I was exploring with some old classmates and current coworkers. One said something about the "other kids" getting candy. So I decided to find it, and voila, found the stairs leading up to the "candy room". I ate sour patch kids and M&Ms. The colors were so vivid and the sugar rush felt real. I think I'm in a childlike place mentally/spiritually.

posts.com:
Had a very short lucid dream last night. I'm a pretty regular lucid dreamer but it's still great to get them.
>reading sheet music in my loungeroom in preparation for a rehearsal
>the piece is real, "Ride" by Sam Hazo ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=au4geHy_S_0 ), but it doesn't look like how it should
>everything's properly legible but it doesn't fit with the piece as I know it
>look up
>a woman I don't really recognise is sitting at the table
>look at the far wall
>there's a bird cage on a pedestal and one of my pet cockatiels sitting on top of the cage
>waitaminute, my last cockatiel died years ago and I got rid of that cage when I decided no more birds
>I'M DREAMING
>there's a decent amount of resistance in the dream to me becoming lucid
>at first there's a small amount of doubt because of how real and normal everything feels, then things shift a little bit and I know that I was correct
>the light coming in the windows disappears like it suddenly became late evening outside
>the woman disappears
>get up and leave the house through the front door
>yep, it's pretty dark, feeling a bit uneasy
>a small insect buzzes my ear, looked like a fly
>grab it and it stays still
>90% sure something bad's going to happen despite my lucidity, which usually means something bad will happen
>reach the street and look down it
>there's a cluster of beautiful blue lights in the road a little bit further down the street
>as I get closer they start to form an emblem, which I was absolutely gobsmacked by its beauty
>took a good look at it so I could attempt to replicate it, but my skills aren't good enough in waking life to do it anywhere near the justice it deserves
>attempt to take a steam screenshot of it, even hear the click and even see the screenshot taken panel in my vision
>think to myself "There's no way that's going to persist after I wake up. A screenshot from a dream would be worldshattering"
>leave the dream an unusual way, feels like I'm being pulled upwards to my bed

>>33590995
for the ultra clear one? I became lucid in the dream, it was accidental
but I remember that I was sleeping disastrously all the previous days, only naps like that day(literally) and at that moment I think I had an alarm activated because I wanted to get up later to eat something... so i guess it was a bit of WBTB too

now i only have lucid dreams when i am a bit sleepy (not too much) i lie on my back and do breathing exercises focusing on it while i am listening to something on youtube at a very low volume
once I think I didn't even do breathing exercises and I only paid attention (a bit) to the audios I put on but I refused to sleep
other times I didn't pay attention to the audio (but still audio playing) but I did pay attention to what I saw in the dark
and other times the same but while I tried to move my "ghost" body (breathing exercises, you feel sleepy but then you start trying to move your body without moving a single muscle, as if you were preparing to move but you don't)... I think this was the most useful for me, now that I remember. I think I'm going to try again right now, I haven't done it in a long time.
the trick is to remain conscious but RELAXED to tell your brain or body that you are already sleeping while your consciousness is still active
Whatever you choose to do, it's extremely important that you do not move a single physical muscle or open your eyes, that's what all my successful attempts agree on

>/x/ and philosophy
Hi /x/, new here. Are any people here into philosophy besides the weird schizoconspiracy shit? I had some mystical insights reading philosophy myself.

At the start of philosophy was Plato, who believed in two realsm. There is the everyday realm, of bodies and objects which whither away, and then there is the timeless realm of the Ideas, which the trained philosopher can percieve with his mind's eye; one can compare this to a third eye of some sorts.

Deleuze believed philosophers created concepts out of the plane of immanence; a sort of undivided "field" of energies, forces, flows, without humans, without subjects, without consciousness. Life, death, and all dualities and dialectical relationships are non-existent on this plane.

Then Schopenhauer. He literally believed that the reality of individual objects in time and space; what he called "the world as representation"; is an illusion; all that exists is the fundamental unity of the Will. You are Will, I am Will, there are no humans, there aren't even beings. This is simply the veil of the Will covering your eyes.

Then Derrida, who believed that language is a completely empty system; that the idea of another person having written this message is an illusion stemming from a belief in "logocentrism".

Berkeley thought all of reality is subjective idas; the only thing binding it together is the universal observer: God.

So, anyone into philosophy? Want to share insights/mystical shit which you found in philosophy?

But at some point you have to let go of those other dudes and embody your own stance, which each of them had also done previously.
Or you can just stop giving a fuck and make that your philosophy, like Diogenes.

posts.sub: The Cult of Creativity and The Creative Singularity
posts.com:
Once upon a time a group of artists, musicians, poets, writers, scientists, philosophers, historians, theologians, engineers, and many others came together from a shared love of learning. They cross-pollinated each other's ideas and experiences with novel insights, helping each other to explore connections between fields they didn't consider before. The more they shared, the more interconnected they found themselves to be. They began to look at what they were doing, and found that their root commonality was creativity. And so they began to worship creativity itself, considering creativity as the most important thing in the world.

The Cult of Creativity spread the message of creativity by organizing public lectures and talks, workshops, star parties, funded libraries, and inspirational messages about the power of creativity. The cult grew and grew, and was welcomed by many as a learning movement.

The cult also investigated the nature of creativity itself. They gathered writings about the nature of creativity through history, and formed novel hypotheses about it. Eventually they discovered something remarkable: A Unified Theory of Creativity that described how natural, biological, and human creativity are connected. They resolved a god-like object, the Ultimate Community, which described the universe as a grand adventure between creative events through all of space and time. Creativity had become omnipresent, a principle of existence itself. With humans, creativity had created co-creators, human creative experience was an extension of the Eros of the universe itself.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
The Unified Theory of Creativity had the effect of making followers of the Cult of Creativity even more devout and motivated to spread the message of creativity. The theory also led to the development of novel methods to help people cultivate their creativity both individually and socially. One member of the Cult of Creativity introduced an idea of a creative singularity, where the collective creativity of humanity would reach critical mass and become explosive, radically changing the way people thought and interacted with the world around them.

Now on a mission to change the entire world with the power of creativity, the cult worked harder than ever. They rapidly gained new members as word spread about how the message of creativity elevated people's lives and appreciation for life. They applied their creative experience to encourage cooperative problem-solving in politics and social disagreements, tackling the most difficult problems of their time. As the power of creativity grew, it became easier and easier to advance cooperation and empathy. The Cult of Creativity was on its way to becoming a global culture.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Then one day a tipping point was reached, striking almost like a bolt of lightning. Nourished by creativity, the power of human goodness was now more powerful than the power of what is essentially socially transmitted bad habits, healing those bad habits on a globally massive scale. The most broken and unfortunate members of global society were lifted up, and found new lives with others. The problem of human conflict had been solved with the emergence of a massive web of mutually reinforcing non-zero-sum relationships that embraced the entire planet. War and exploitation was over.

With their global civilization now a Utopia, the Cult of Creativity had proven the limitless power of creativity once and for all. But they didn't stop there, they looked to the stars and learned to travel to them. They found a small planet inhabited by intelligent beings, who were troubled like they used to be. They wanted to help them, but not erase their own culture, and so they worked extremely gently, discreetly sharing a small idea or inspiration here and there, that would have snowball effects, letting natural cultural evolution do the work. Eventually the alien civilization experienced its own creative singularity, and were embraced by their alien friends as equals, with their own unique culture, history, and ideas.

>>33618209
To add on a little bit: A child is infinitely creative. As we grow older we learn the 'rules' of the real world and subconsciously apply them to our creativity, which constrains it. For example a child can think of the wildest random shit that doesn't make any sense and doesn't follow real world situations or intuitions, but it's much harder as an adult. This isn't particularly a bad thing, since applying rules to creativity allows us to try and predict the future and apply creativity in a pragmatic sense. However, we must learn to turn off those rules or selectively only apply the ones that are useful. Einstein was a pro at doing this with his thought experiments, he was able to concretely apply equations in his mind's eye and focus only on them without any other conceptions.
