>How do I use this to be more creative? Like an example or
As of yet the Religion of Creativity is only a dream. However I can give insight into the fundamental process of human creativity.
Human consciousness is an evolutionary process where question, choice, and action correspond to mutation, selection, and reproduction in biological evolution. A question is a request for information, our entire sense-experience is the result of a request for information by our nervous system, and constantly mutates our consciousness. We can also actively mutate our consciousness by asking questions of our experiences, actions, choices, and ideas, and follow the resulting lines of inquiry to apprehend new possibilities previously beyond our immediate reach. From there, the selective mechanism of choice eliminates possibilities until one option is chosen to be expressed as an action.

There are two unhealthy versions of this process. In one, choice is favored at the expense of questioning, resulting in a progressive whittling-down of variation until stagnation is reached - this process is all selection with minimal mutation. Also one can start with a desired answer, and ask questions about how to confirm it - this is the method of confirmation bias. The healthy process must start by questioning experience.

The implication of this is to promote freedom, promote inquiry. Seek The Unknown, among the most profound experiences of which is wonder. The world is filled with endless opportunities for wonder, but to find them requires a conscious effort to shake-up your routines and get out of your comfort zone. Perhaps understanding the supreme importance of questioning and seeking The Unknown for your freedom could motivate you. Wonder is the carrot, the stick is the risk of being enslaved by your own stagnant thoughts and habits, or the stagnant thoughts and habits of others.

I was thinking about questions earlier. I find myself stuck in loops of questions when my creativity is drifting, my focus or flow, my presence, engagement, curiosity etc.
I told myself there is no reason to ask questions, because I know the answer is implicit in the question anyway, and all I do by questioning is limit myself to a certain surface of perception or experience.
Answers and questions . . . I want what is, I think, and to get that I think I simply look at it. If I look at a question, I look at its absence; if I look at its answer, I look at the destination of questions and feel the absence then of the enquiry.
I do not think there can be any absence in creativity. There must be, and will be, something interesting everywhere I look.

Everything becomes strange and new with each moment. That is the state of presence Eckhart Tolle speaks of, the thoughtless place of awareness where you simply perceive what is, including thoughts and visions, without getting sucked into them, but keeping your distance, aware that you are aware. In that way you see things you have no words or concepts for everywhere you look and the only way to know them is to know them outside of any structure the mind can conceive of. It's from this place that a structure can generate to point at what generated it, though it is not it itself, and is perishable.

>>33618869
I think one good place to start is to reconnect with the natural world, which is the true church of creativity. The experience and appreciation of natural beauty moves the soul like nothing else.

When I was a young teenager, I looked up at the night sky and saw a blurry object that I thought could be a UFO. I looked in an amateur astronomy book my aunt had gifted me, and discovered that it was the Cassiopeia star cluster. I also read that most people with good eyesight see individual stars rather than a blur. I realized that I had poor vision informed my father, saw an optometrist, and got glasses. All of a sudden my world was in super-HD. I looked up at the night sky and saw a field of sparkling diamonds. I read the book more, began to learn the constellations, and got more interested in amateur astronomy.

I became obsessed, reading books and magazines about amateur astronomy, I got a telescope for Christmas and began to observe deep-space objects such as nebulae and galaxies. The more I learned and experienced, the greater the appreciation grew. One night I was staring up at a night sky and something like a gestalt of everything I had experienced and learned came together in a unified experience of complete and total awe that moved me to tears. It was an experience of unfathomable vastness, yet unified inter-connectivity - the universe wasn't "out there" but here.

There are many other ways to explore and appreciate natural beauty, and through it cultivate a sense of inter-connection with nature and the universe. What calls to you?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

Lately when I sit down and meditate I feel like the stakes are really high... in terms of what I'm thinking about. It's been hard to relax.

Sometimes I'm worrying if I'm having a negative influence on my thinking by meditating too much, or maybe I'm doing it in a wrong way, but then I remember it's all about relaxation and getting back to central one-ness.

I am not a strict buddhist or anything, the dogma of it is not important, but I think regardless of whatever cult people are into, really cultivating focus in the mind is an important thing.

I haven't really had love in a long time, so I think in my advancing age it might be best to focus on the particulars of ordinary life and that's pretty much all I have to say.

One example of an informational hazard could be a person who discovers a secret about a loved one that causes them immense emotional distress. For instance, imagine that a person discovers that their spouse has been cheating on them for years. This information can cause intense feelings of betrayal, hurt, and anger, and the knowledge of the infidelity can have long-lasting effects on the person's emotional well-being and relationships.

Another example of an informational hazard could be a person who discovers a secret about the world that fundamentally challenges their beliefs and worldview. For instance, imagine that a person who has always believed in the existence of a benevolent higher power discovers evidence that suggests otherwise. This information could cause them to doubt their faith and struggle with feelings of disillusionment and confusion.

Adorable calico!

Anyway, here's my dark secrets:
Eat a balanced diet (no more than 20% grains). Try to eat one gram of protein per body weight per day. It's good for muscles and bones.
Don't eat refined sugars. Mostly empty calories there and it's easy to eat too much sugar. The body isn't made to handle too much sugar in adulthood.
Exercise at least twice a week for one hour at a time. Do anything that gets your heart pumping. Playing drums is as valid as running. Weights are for muscle building- optional but useful.
Get at least 6 hours sleep a night.
Drink at least 6 cups of water or non-caffinated teas a day.
Watch your nutrient intakes. Most Americans are deficient in potassium and Omega 3. This causes brain and nerve problems over time. Get nutritional info and tally things up to get more ideas of what things you need.

Simple stuff but most people neglect it so they end up in poor health. Supplements are useful, but they don't replace making sure your body has all the basics you need to be healthy.

Oh hi, I wasn't expecting my old forum stories to be screenshotted. I'm the anon who originally wrote these, as a matter of fact, I guess since people seem so interested I should share a few more.

This happened a bit before I got sent the weird video that killed my urge to prowl dead forums, probably 2-3 weeks. I had found an old forum dedicated to world of darkness (the franchise that vampire the masquerade is a part of), and I was giving it my preliminary examination. Or more simply, I was trying to find who I'd troll, and what I should ask them. I found a profile of some dipshit who displayed a ton of his personal information, even had his phone number and PO box up, and this gave me an idea. I should mention that whenever I do make calls, I usually use the ancient landline in my home. I do have a cellular phone, but I try and only use it for my family and close friends. I wrote down the number, and I went into the guest bedroom, where the landline was for whatever reason. I felt my hands start shaking as I started dialing the number, the excitement of prank calling was making me jumpy.

The phone rang for a minute or two, and just as I was about to give up and hang up someone picked up. "I told you not to fuckin' call back here." It was a gruff, older man's voice, and were it not for his words, I wouldn't have known he was angry, his tone was very stoic and unemotive. "You fucking whore, fucking die." I hardly got the chance to come up with a witty rebuttal or try and fuck with the guy before the call ended. Never bothered trying to call again.

The roots of the theory lead to Immanuel Velikovsky when he argued for the possibility of a planetary cataclysm against Carl "Reddit" Sagan decades ago, but was focused on Venus in the aspect of a comet.
Skip to the 90s and a physicist from U Arizona, Anthony Peratt, mapped a ridiculous number of neolithic petroglyphs spread globally and connected them to laboratory produced plasma discharge patterns (lightning). He found that the majority of them were in caves with a view to the South geographic pole, but shielded from the North. In almost all cases he was able to reproduce these (supposedly by means of lysergic nature in mainstream academia) "crude" pictures through different configurations of electrical phenomena.
Since then the Electric Universe guys popped up, with which Peratt was never associated, but despite a couple fallacies, as to be expected from amateurs, they have made a lot of good mythological connections under the hypothesis that the solar system has only recently stabilized into he orbits we see today.

Nice get.

>I feel everyone hates or grows tired of me
I felt that way, too. Then I realized a lot of it was in my head, internalized from going though hell when I was younger. The rest was the fact I was surrounded by shallow gits. Shallow people and deeper people naturally do not get along in the long term.

The first step was teaching myself that people don't hate me, especially if they hardly know me. They actually are indifferent most of the time. As to the ones who "know" you and "hate" you, stop and think about how much they get right about you. If it isn't that much, then they hate their preconceived notion of you. Hating you without really knowing you marks them as shallow fools not worth your time. Forget them. Let them go be shallow elsewhere. You don't need these people in your life.

>Thank you but how am I important
Part of being loved is also loving yourself and learning where you fit in with the world. Learning to love yourself can be hard when you have not been loved very much, but it's important. In the end you are the one person who can never leave you. Because of this, you need to accept yourself, see your value and importance as a person, and eventually love yourself. Ignore any nattering thoughts that you are not worthy or lovable: those are lies. You are worthy of love and good things. You can heal and feel better. I beleive in you!

It's also easy to ignore your physical self. If you don't care for yourself, then you can't get anything done long term. Take good care of yourself. Eat well, sleep well, drink your water and exercise. Don't smoke or engage in self-destructive behaviors. You will sober up and the problem will still be there.

It's a hard road. I know. I wish I could give you a hug and some company. You are seriously cute so hey- maybe a lot more than a hug. For now, though, all I can give is what I have learned over time. I hope it helps you find your way.

the only reason i said that is because it made me feel better for a moment about my situation; ive been bitchmade my entire life. it is in my blood to be the human equivalent of an object, like a hand tool or piece of furniture. the phrase "ordained by fate" rings in my head every time i remind myself of this. i have been quiet, and submissive, and obsessively out-of-the-way for decades, and even though i want to change things about my own life and manipulate whatever flows of energy and synchronicity i can grasp, and even though ive been making positive changes, i still feel that it is my fate, ordained by whoever you send your complaints to, to remain an object.
i willingly play into it too, because i feel that a part of my responsibility as a man is to be an immovable object, and to be reliable and trustworthy and kind and a bunch of other shit, and a part of that is having no cracks in my armor. if anyone sees anything that could be a potential weakness, i will be left behind, and i will suffer the terrible fate of being useless again. so i fake a lot. im fine, all the time, and dont need anything from anyone, and i never ask anything of anyone. because my idea is of a man who is totally solid and independent, and needs nothing he can't get himself. i put on a cowboy hat and grimace at the setting sun through cigar smoke when my work is done.

i am not happy. happiness is a pretty bird that flies through your backyard occasionally. it is a shooting star that greets you conveniently as you look up to exhale cigarette smoke. happiness is in rainbows. it is not a state of being. but i dont know how i know these things, because i dont think i have ever been truly happy. maybe im ignoring a qualifying moment because im in a bitchy mood right now and i want to finish writing this fucking novel of a 4chan dot org post for my own amusement and liberation. but this is the biggest thing ive realized recently. i am somewhere between not happy and unhappy. i cant tell.
i feel like patrick "literally me" bateman during his final monologue. even as i admit this to strange men on the internet, and i flaunt my inability to make sense of it (maybe in a weakling's attempt to garner help in understanding this), there is no catharsis. my insides are outside, like a body undergoing study in a morgue, but there is no cause of death. im just a shell of a human. i dont feel like a human, and i feel a broiling terror inside myself that i really don't care about anybody else at all, but the more honest i get with myself, the greater my clarity grows.
i am selfish, and mechanical. im really just like anyone else, except im (snarkily) more honest about my core tenants. the world will go on forever. my bones will stand in soil like a colosseum, and will crumble with just as much determination. chimps on a rock duuude lmao.

You design it consciously. Keep it simple. Furnish it with the neccesary symbolic paraphernalia you need for your purposes. You don't need to do it all at once. Then you explore it in trance repeatedly in order to give it substance.
Over time you can modify your design or even explore parts of it you purposefully left ambiguous for your subconscious to give you information. For example, have a stage or a cinema screen so that you can ask to be shown scenes. Or have a teleporter or an elevator that can take you to places you want to know more about.
It sounds like pure make-believe (and it is), but it is a powerful psychological and magical tool.

>I think that assuming . . . is a bit naive.
When I make generalizations I think of it this way: When you zoom out to a 100k mile high view of the Earth, the Earth appears like a mottled blue orb. Saying "the Earth is blue" sounds dumb if you're standing on grass, under a tree, somewhere on earth. You'd feel inclined to say the Earth is green from your more high-resolution experience at ground level. But that's not to say that the spectrometry of Earth from a long distance away wouldn't be right to call the Earth blue. So when I ask what the nature of 4chan is I'm talking on a broad scale. If some retard picks up my declaration that 4chan has some characteristic, and makes naive claims or actions based on my initial declaration, that's not my problem

>tell me what that dark spots are, that can be seen on 2 pics are, i gave you a timestamp, picrel
What dark spots? Be specific. If they're not blue/blueish then they are likely variations in land color. This isn't that difficult.

>im not a lens expert, but what does the focus have to do with distortion, actually curious
When you focus a lens you are literally changing the relative position of the lens elements to each other and/or to the film/sensor. Lens distortions are often better corrected at one focus distance than another. Most lenses optimize corrections for infinity, though some choose another distance (i.e. portrait lenses).

That said, no rectilinear lens is going to have such distortion that a straight line through the center is going to warp into a curve, facing head on/level. UWA lenses will sometimes curve the horizon when the horizon is placed near an edge. But we don't see any of that with this lens as the camera rotates and the Earth moves in/out of view. It is very well corrected.

>because when you cant straw man, your shitty arguments dont work anymore?
Because disproving globe Earth requires explaining a mountain of observations which point to a globe Earth.

>shifting the burden of proof fallacy

>>33622370
>THE PROFESSOR OF PHYSICS HAD NO ANSWER TO THE LITTLE BOX CONTRADICTION.
Flerfers often claim the globe can't be real because "gas pressure without container = impossible." They claim that Earth's atmosphere would violently fly off into space without a container, and deny that gravity could hold gas molecules to Earth. Are they right?

First, let's establish via experiment that a force can create gas pressure. In this case it's magnetism, but we just want to debunk the idea that a container is absolutely necessary.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_confinement_fusion

Next let's look at the force of gravity.

Escape velocity for Earth: 11,186 m/s (meters per second)
Source: https://www.omnicalculator.com/physics/escape-velocity

Molar mass of H2O: 18.01528 g/mol
Source: https://www.google.com/search?q=h2o+molar+mass

Root Mean Square Velocity of H2O at 1,200C/1,473.15K, the peak temperature in the Exosphere: 1,428.17 m/s
Source: http://calistry.org/calculate/kineticTheoryVelocityCalculator

At 1,200C H2O is moving at a velocity which is 9,757.83 m/s too slow to escape Earth's gravity (only 12.8% of the required velocity). It's moving fast enough to move up and out of a pressurized container opened in a room in vacuum. But if that room extended all the way to space, the H2O molecules would never get to the top and escape. They would literally run out of kinetic energy, like a rocket running out of fuel, and fall back down.

At 75F/297.039K H2O is only moving at 641.30 m/s, or 5.7% of the required speed to escape Earth.

Since oxygen exists as O2 in the atmosphere, and nitrogen as N2, H2O is the fastest moving of the three. It's also much faster than CO2.

>THE PROFESSOR OF PHYSICS HAD NO ANSWER TO THE LITTLE BOX CONTRADICTION.
The Box That Killed The Dome

If you remove the lid of a pressurized box of air inside of a vacuum chamber without gravity, the air will violently rush out of the box to fill the vacuum. The air pressure will then be the same at every point in the chamber. It will be the same at the top, bottom, middle, and at all sides. Just like the air pressure in your car tires or a balloon or a SCUBA tank.

This thought experiment debunks the entire flat Earth model. If the air does not cling to the bottom of the chamber, then it certainly would not cling to the bottom of flat Earth. If the air does not leave any part of the chamber still in vacuum, then it certainly would not leave any part of flat Earth in vacuum. And if the air creates equal pressure at all points in the chamber, then certainly the air creates equal pressure at all points in the flat Earth dome.

Yet there is no denying that air thins as you climb in altitude. At 100,000 feet, somewhere near the top of the theorized dome, the air pressure is so low that it is effectively a vacuum.

This alone debunks all of flat Earth.

Note: no flerfer has ever provided a workable answer to this. They immediately sperg out if you even mention it, and rant and rave that the box thought experiment actually kills the globe. The only way they can do this, of course, is to deny gravity. But if gravity doesn't exist then the dome is just as dead. And if it does exist, the globe model works, while the dome remains...dead.

Everything flerfs post is a previously debunked lie. They have no new material, no answer for any counter argument. They just wait a while and then post the same shit over and over and over again.

FLERFERS LIE

Take a close look at the attached pic. Flerfers often post it as proof the Earth is flat. Why do I want you to look at it? Because it's a lie.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

>>33631339


CBR Proves Earth's Motion Through Space

The ability to measure the cosmic background radiation (CBR) gives us something the physicists of the early/mid 20th century could only dream of: a universal frame of reference by which to establish if Earth is really moving linearly or if it just appears to be. The CBR permeates all of space. If an object is at rest relative to the CBR then the frequencies observed will be the same in all directions. If an object is moving relative to the CBR, then Doppler shift will reveal in what direction and how fast.

We measured this phenomenon and established Earth's linear motion through space using the COBE satellite in operation from 1989 to 1993. What did we find? That the Earth is definitely moving through the cosmos.

https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-fast-is-the-earth-mov/

>In 1989, the COBE satellite was placed in orbit about the earth (again, the earth is the frame of reference!) to measure the long-diluted radiation echo of the birth of our universe. This radiation, which remains from the immensely hot and dense primordial fireball that was our early universe, is known as the cosmic microwave background radiation (CBR). The CBR presently pervades all of space. It is the equivalent of the entire universe "glowing with heat."
>One of COBE's discoveries was that the earth was moving with respect to this CBR with a well-defined speed and direction. Because the CBR permeates all space, we can finally answer the original question fully, using the CBR as the frame of reference.
>The earth is moving with respect to the CBR at a speed of 390 kilometers per second. We can also specify the direction relative to the CBR. It is more fun, though, to look up into the night sky and find the constellation known as Leo (the Lion). The earth is moving toward Leo at the dizzying speed of 390 kilometers per second.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33595807
Your body is physically lifting (itself) up or you have the sensation of floating upwards? For some, leaving the body can feel the way you're describing. Other people "roll out" or "twist out" or "leak out" from their body, and some even just appear outside. There are lots of somatic sensations taking place when you practice mind-awake-body-asleep states of consciousness.

>>33595834
If you want to progress further in this, you will have to work on your fear response. Fear is such a disruption to the process of going OOB. Visual sensations such as the one you're posting are also present in feinting episodes. The vibrations are also part of many people's response.

So, take heart: you have good potential to regularly go OOB, but you're going to want to work out your fear response. OOB is probably the most harmless thing you can do as a mind, precisely because what you know of harm is explicitly linked to the physical material of the body. So... nothing is going to hurt you, you're not going to get stuck in a strange place, and you are likely to experience something that fundamentally encourages your growth beyond limits you've unwittingly created for yourself.

I went through a few of these tapes last week up to the last bit of focus 10.
I never really understood what the fuck focus 3 even was. I got to the bit about touching your neck as a trigger/anchor for mixing mind and brain (I don't know what that even means) and the one where you touch your forehead to remember anything. Neither one has really worked for me, these triggers.
One thing which HAS been a wonderful development is the relaxation of my body. posts.com:
Since there is no astral projection general I need to post this here. I just had an OBE and I encountered a “love parasite”.
I was feeling lovey towards someone and after basking in that feeling after a while I began revisiting my pas relationships and how “love” doesn’t always feel the same. Sometimes it’s more lustful, or more obsessive. I tried to see if there was an essential quality to it and I turned to the “love” I feel towards different members of my family. I fell asleep exploring these feelings.
Then I woke up in sleep paralysis and started hearing a voice. It was a placid female voice who said
>my aim is to spread through feelings of warmth and (something I forgot)
Then I felt it taking me out of my body. I’m usually very much capable and in control when it comes to AP. But this thing had neutralized me completely. I was mesmerized and defenseless. I tried to generate feelings of coldness or cynicism, but I couldn’t. It’s as if my emotional body was neutralized somehow.
I managed to float/turn around towards the voice and I saw a flickering, humming ball of light if a sickly yellow slowly sucking me in (but I KNEW what it wanted was to get me out of the way to get my body).
At that point I panicked and I jerked myself awake with an audible
>NO YOU DONT MOTHERFUCKER
I don’t know if this is something I created while experimenting with generating emotions before falling asleep or something I called.
The thing is all I could feel was warmth and softness. I could never feel anything but that. No fear or alarm until the last moment. It was as if I experienced a different kind of “emotional paralysis”.
Now I do feel fear. It terrifies me to get a glimpse into the kind of astral wildlife “threats” that are out there that humans aren’t even equipped to understand. No wonder we are in this mess of a society. We’re completely dumb and blind with regards to the greater reality.
